title: Counseling
description: Michael is forced to go through counseling with Toby, Dwight seeks revenge on a local mall that refused his business, and Pam tries to fake her way to a promotion.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow. Late every day this week.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We signed Cici up for this daycare. It's on the other side of town. The traffic...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why didn't I think of this before? Did you know that there is a daycare center opening right here in this building?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is there really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now that I own the building, I'm looking for new sources of revenue. And a daycare center... Ha ha ha [laughing maniacally] Well I guess it's not an evil idea. It's just a regular idea. But there is no good laugh for a regular idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome to the Sesame Avenue Daycare Center for infants and toddlers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aaah!

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Aaah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You remember my cousin Mose.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Welcome children.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Were you painting in the dark?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait. Is this your place Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no. I like to think of it as a kids place. Would you like a tour?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't really think we need...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh... lets take the tour Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. Here is the language skills and cognitive development area. These are English... uh... letters. [pause] I see you found out magical toy box Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: These are actually forks and knives from the break room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! To you and me, maybe, but, come on! To a child's imagination that's Mr. Fork and Lieutenant Knife and... Ms. Fork.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And a soy sauce packet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh! That shouldn't have been in there. I'm embarrassed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't beat yourself up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We come fully equipped with a restroom. Feeding trough, play bucket, and room for a plant, in success.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who will be watching the children?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No one. The door locks from the outside. Escape is impossible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Prove it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Were going to head outside, give it a whirl. I just want to see how it works.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But I'll tell you this, if this works out, I think we're looking real good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I promise you, that door locks! [Jim closes the door]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What's something that you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is the worst! You are the worst! I hate looking at your face! I wanna smash it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, you know what? I made a mistake. I committed corporate punishment. My bad. It's over. It's done. But my punishment is ... um ... worse than hell.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael has been assigned six hours of mandatory counseling with a trained professional. I actually have a degree in social work. I mean, I know a lot of people would ask a few standard questions, and check off a few boxes, but I've got a chance to do some good here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know what you want to ask me. "Did your mom ever see you naked?"

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We can do this with more privacy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you can molest me? Oh, ok. I don't think so. We're going to leave the blinds open so every one can see what a big failure you are. That's the key.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Boycott the Steamtown Mall! Everyone, you heard me! Cancel all of your business with the Steamtown Mall!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: The mall itself or just the stores in the mall?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All of it! The mall, the stores, the kiosks!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: America is one big mall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did something happen Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, something happened. Oh yeah, something happened, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, tell us what it is. I mean, it would help us to get some context so we can get on board.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't want to know.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'd like you to imagine a place where you feel very peaceful. For me, it's the walk from the yogurt shop to my car after I drop my daughter off on Sunday afternoons.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm glad Michael is getting help. He as a lot of issues, and he's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Look, I'm not going to tell you that we have lower prices. Is price something that is important to you? Ok, well let me know if anything changes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't do this. I don't have this sales gene, or whatever it is. Tell me everything is going to be ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Everything is going to be ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tell me I'm good at sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're good... you're good at sales.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The unfair thing about working in sales is that your salary is almost all commission. So, you suck at sales, you make almost no money. I guess that's fair.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you call all of my clients at the mall and cancel all my business while using the "F" word?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I did. And I'm going to do the same with all of your clients.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No you will not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh yes I will! That mall is corrupt, ok! They're "appearance"ists!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight. We can't do that. So why don't you just tell us what happened?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, what happened Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You guys know me. You know that I'm not one for fancy things, but there was this one thing. It was in a fancy store. And it caught the corner of my eye when I took Mose down to the Mall to get his blood pressure at the Rite-Aid. And I thought, you know, maybe I deserve this. You know, I had a great crop yield this fall...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So what happened?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I went to the store and I pressed the buzzer, and they looked right at me, and then they looked away. And then I pressed the buzzer again, and they started taking pictures of me on their mobile phones. I guess I'm not the kind of guy that's good enough for precious heirlooms.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You know what Dwight? You need to go back there, and you need to "Pretty Woman" their asses.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: We should start our own mall!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait. That's actually a really good idea Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What did I say?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I talk a lot, so I've learned to just tune myself out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, how about this? Instead of boycotting, you and I, together, go down to that store and we teach those snobs a lesson.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, you and I... and I. I'm going to come with you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you assume that I would automatically side with the rich snobby shop owner? [removes cuff link] How about now? [removes other cuff link] How about now? [removes tie clip] How about now?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh... what was your favorite flavor of...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One hour.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One hour. We've done one hour. Let's just speed this up, ok? Keep it moving. I want to do all six hours today.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ok, I can't count the hour if you don't talk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no! I know my rights! All I had to do was sit here for six hours. Do my time.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, it's up to me to check off the boxes, and I can't do that unless I honestly...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, do you have any idea how angry this is making me?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Tell me!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I think we might be about to maybe really get somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I will. I will talk alright. Be careful what you wish for Toby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Apparently there is a famous Hollywood movie from the 1980's, Beautiful Girl...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pretty Woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Apparently, it's one of the best revenge stories of all times, in which this sex worker, who is the antagonist... That can't be right. Andy? How does it...?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no. I want to hear you tell it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, Um... The sex worker is denied service at a fancy store because she does not look wealthy. She later returns dressed in all the "trappings" of extravagant wealth, but instead of going...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Julia Roberts goes into the store, and she's like," I was in here yesterday and you wouldn't help me." And the shop girl goes, "ok". And Julia Roberts goes," You girls work on commission, right?" And the girl is like,"Yeah", and Julia Roberts goes...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: "Big mistake! Huge!"

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was telling that... I was telling that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How many paper supplies and ink cartridges to go with that? Ok, sure.

quotes.speaker: Window Treatment Guy
quotes.text: Who can I speak to in this office about saving on window treatments?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Window Treatment Guy
quotes.text: Is one of you the office administrator?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hesitates] I am. I am the office administrator!

quotes.speaker: Window Treatment Guy
quotes.text: Can I show you a few samples?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, we're not interested. We're not interested at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There are a few ways to get promoted. One is to wait for an opening and apply for it. That's the main way. But this could work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby, can I really tell you anything?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, the other night, I was sitting at the table, eating my penis... I mean peas. That was weird. Aaaah... weird. I think that was ... I was probed. By an alien life form. An A.L.F. Alf, you know, I might have actually been probed by Alf. You might think he's a puppet. You never see the lower half. But there is a lower half.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Office Administrator. So when did this happen?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A few months ago. I was talking to someone at corporate, who isn't there anymore, and I think the paperwork just got lost in the shuffle. Can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, totally. Well, congrats!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks! Yeah, so I'm just going to take care of things around the office and get paid a reasonable salary. You believe that, right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Totally, that's great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I get paid $40,000 per year.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Before me stands your coworker, Dwight Kurt Schrute. Dwight, show them all sides. Turn around. Now, today, we need your help turning Dwight into a gentleman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A gentleman who is a rich snob who will go into shopping malls and drop huge amounts of cash on clothes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is he still doing his boycott?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, this is instead of the boycott. Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You shirt and tie are disgusto-barfo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Agreed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe something not so monochromatic. Not so matching.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait. Less matching to appear more rich?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The glasses are a little...  [Dwight drops glasses to the floor, stomps on them]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I liked them.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I thought they were kind of cute.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I liked them too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't see.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Say stuff like, "Good morning, Good Afternoon". People appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, I see you every day. Can I say "Good month?"

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm telling you how to do this man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If someone offers you a cocktail, accept, but keep your wits about you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Please and thank you go a long way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Copy. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in a cockney accent] I think he's got it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I was raised by wolves. I was 25 years old before I saw my first human being. Wait, is it a full moon tonight? [howls and growls like a werewolf]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Come on Michael. Those are all fake stories.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Yes. They are all fake stories. What sort of twisted mind would come up with weird stories like that? [pause] Three hours. We're half way done.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, do you have a second?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, as I am sure you know, for the past few months, I've been the Office Administrator. Since right before you guys took over.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Right, of course!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And, I haven't gotten paid yet. I'm not blaming you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just think somebody lost the paperwork.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh boy. Can you get every department head's signature on this so I can back this up to corporate?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Absolutely. Right away.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know what Michael? You're right. You win. This is pointless. We're not getting anywhere. I got a bunch of fun stuff, in case my daughter ever comes over. Why don't we just run out the clock by playing games, drawing some pictures, talking?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [fanfare]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We present to you for your comments and approval, Dwight K. Shrute.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Go get 'em Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wish us luck!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight [snaps a picture with a disposable camera, then drops the camera in the trash can]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Disposable cameras are fun, although it does seem wasteful and you don't ever get to see your pictures. If it's an important even that you want to remember, I recommend using a real camera. But I don't care if I forget today.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We can play something more complicated if you like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is plenty complicated.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So you have played it before?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've played it once or twice with Jeff.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who's Jeff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jeff was my mother's boyfriend, who she married.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So, her husband, your stepdad?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Yeah. I guess I never thought about it that way, though.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Did you guys do much stuff together?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You know what? He took me to a baseball game once, I remember. It was weird though. They took the pitcher out of the game. I felt really bad, because the pitcher wasn't able to play with his friends anymore. But Jeff said that the manager was making a really good move, by taking the pitcher out. He really respected the manager.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's working. I'm doing it!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [coughs for attention]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My place tonight. Wear this. [motioning to his new outfit]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have your card?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes. Don't forget the pipe.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Its really sad that your dog ran away. Why did it keep you from going to the park?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was afraid I would find him in the park, playing with another kid.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I guess that's why I thought he ran away in the first place. To find a kid he liked better.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Dogs don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right. Why would a dog do that? That's silly.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I hear myself say it, it sounds ridiculous. But I've never said it out loud, so...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's very important for you to be liked, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, lets not get too... This isn't a counseling session... Ok. Son of a gun. Son of a bitch. Wow! Ok.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm just trying to help you Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You. Bitch. God! You're very helpful aren't you? You try to help everybody. Do you want to play another game?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I just want to...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are good. But you know what? You can't help people. You couldn't help your marriage. You lose. I don't need your help. Nobody needs your help. Nobody wants it! You can't help anybody. I don't need your help! Am I going to make you cry?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [tossing forms at Michael] Just fill them out any way you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'll have Erin fax them back to corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You'll do. . . ok. Filled out. Good. Thank you doctor. Take two of these [giving Toby two middle fingers] and call me in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Michael, um... about three months ago, I was talking to... [Michael grabs form and signs it without reading.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There are a lot of one person departments here, so, there's a lot of department heads. But I'm off to a good start. Oh, man! If I could pull this off, it will be scam of all scams. And yet very helpful to everyone.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: So, Corporate got your evaluations, and they want me to check, is that really how you feel about Michaels situation?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That is not how it seems to me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He seems fine.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: You marked severe in all the categories, including at risk for homicidal behavior.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Heh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I saw a TLC show on Kate Walsh's home office. All corkboard.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can do that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Right in here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Easily.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm back! Ha ha. Pam, perfect. I was hoping to talk to the office administrator about a little office administration problem.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But of course!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: The problem, unfortunately, is about the office administrator. I have gone through everything for the past three years. There is nothing that says you are the office administrator.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So weird that there is no paperwork.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: At all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Although, like, unlikely things happen all the time. My best friend, in High School, she went to Australia, Canberra I think, and she met this guy who lived only two streets away in America.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Pam, I don't want to accuse you of anything. I just want everything to be back the way it's supposed to be. Can you just admit... admit...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Admit what?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't want to say it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Say it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Say that I'm lying or say that I have the job. Make a definitive statement, Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Statements of such nature, while they have their place, are overused in a competitive business environment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great. Well, Let me know if you need a new chair, or anything that an Office Administrator can handle.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Will do... Can I get one of those name plates... that says Gabe Lewis?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure. Anything else?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll get it right away.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The first lesson of watching World Poker Tour at 2:00 AM, you play the opponent. Not the cards.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that what you were here for? A crystal wizard? I like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is a pewter wizard holding a crystal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait a second. You know you can't buy that now, right? And I can come back and get it for you later. But I'm saying right now, we can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because I'm here for one thing. Revenge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: Let me know if I can help you with anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me sir.

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was here yesterday, and you refused to wait on me.

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: I remember, yes. I'm terribly sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You work on commission, don't you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop, stop, stop.

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: No, we don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you just say you remember him?

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: Of course, but he looks much less threatening now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: We had a safety concern. Um... we very politely indicated that he'd be welcome back...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good Morning!

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: If he were in accordance with our dress policy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: But the blood stained hands...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was beet juice! I am a beet farmer idi...

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: I'm very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good sir. I happen to have been working a very long day. When I came to you fine establishment. You are such a... I'm gonna... Ok. Listen. You can't treat... Thank you! Good morning sir!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Lets just go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You made a big mistake. Huge!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There it is. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: After you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [re-entering the store] I'll take the wizard!

quotes.speaker: Salesman
quotes.text: Oh, ok!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You forged them! You forged the forms!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You filled them in and faxed them yourself!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You remember that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, but you had me so worked up that I made a mistake.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Unless part of you made that mistake on purpose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't make a mistake on purpose, Toby! Then it is no longer a mistake... Gabe. He messed it up. He messed up the forms, I bet... [mimicking Gabe] "I mess everything up so I can fix it and keep my job! Bah! Good thing I'm here cause I do nothing. I make everybody nervous!" [normal voice] Ah, ok. Got your notebook? Alright. Alright, lets bang this out. Let's do it to it!
